doc.field: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
Rotunda: James Dinsmore & John Neilson Memorial
creation: 1822-1826; alteration: 1861; alteration: 27 Oct 1895; alteration: 1896-1898; alteration: 1976

Library & Classrooms--Dome envisioned by Jefferson to be painted blue with gilt constellations as the 1st plantetarium in America - not realized--1st use of Cyma Shaped Space in America--Marble Capital Fragments located at Architecture School & Magruder Sanitarium--Half Scale Pantheon

3 Story Brick, Dome, Figural Spaces, 6 Corinthian Column Portico, Marble Capitals from Carrara Italy, Oculus, Flemish Bond, Clock, Bell, 2 Leaf Door, Pedimented Lintels, Blind Windows, Gymnasia with Lunettes & Balustrade
James Dinsmore, John Neilson, Thorn & Chamberlain, Builders 1822-26--Stanford White, Architect 1896-98--George Sidney Ford, 15' lantern--Ballou and Justice with Frederick Nichols, Architects 1976
survey data: World Heritage List--National Historic Landmark--National Register of Historic Places%Virginia Landmarks Register
